availability.p: All research and writing of Civil War Governors of Kentucky Digital Documentary Edition annotations was undertaken by project staff, volunteers, and interns. Each record contains citations to relevant primary and secondary source material. All annotations are copyright Kentucky Historical Society, and should be referenced as such in any published work.

seriesStmt.title: Civil War Governors of Kentucky Digital Documentary Edition

body.p: Mercer County, Kentucky, farmer. Kentucky native. Married to Nancy Young Lester in Washington County, Kentucky, in 1830. Father of Erasmus Lester, John Lester, Julian Lester, Jesse Lester, Rachel Lester, Elizabeth Lester, Amanda Lester, Martha Lester, Thomas M. Lester, and Obadiah W. Lester, Jr. Farmer in Mercer County, Kentucky in 1850. Household owned two enslaved persons in Mercer County in 1850. Farmer in Mercer County, Kentucky in 1860.

ab.bibl:
Seventh Manuscript Census of the United States (1850), Population Schedules, Kentucky, Mercer County, District 2, p. 352A.
Seventh Manuscript Census of the United States (1850), Slave Schedules, Kentucky, Mercer County, District 2.
Eighth Manuscript Census of the United States (1860), Population Schedules, Kentucky, Mercer County, District 2, p. 581.
Ninth Manuscript Census of the United States (1870), Population Schedules, Kentucky, Mercer County, Precinct 8, p. 578A.
Kentucky Marriage Records, Madison County Courthouse, Richmond, Kentucky, Washington County Marriages, Film 000241382.
"Obadiah Winfield Lester Sr. (1806-1884)," Find A Grave, Memorial 35901957, accessed July 8, 2022, http://www.findagrave.com/memorial/35901957.
